page.title: 08TRANSPORT PLEAN & COWIE AREA
page.content: There is public transport to Falkirk and Stirling in the villages of Plean and Cowie. However at West Plean there is no public transport. Children come to school in a taxi provided by the education authority. Others walk or cycle. Every family in the school owns at least one car. The children remain in school at lunchtime and meals are brought in containers from Bannockburn High School. Very few of the families use the railway. Normally when going on holiday families travel by coach or car.
